properties.headline: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Thursday 1 to Monday 12 April - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses in the precinct will be diverting while roads are closed. Express trains and Major Event Buses run daily - use your Opal card. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show at Sydney Olympic Park from Thursday 1 April until Monday 12 April. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the precinct throughout the show, particularly over the Easter Long Weekend. 

Attendees driving to the event should plan to arrive early and pre-book parking online in advance as car parks typically reach capacity from the early morning on weekends.

Roads in the precinct will be closed from 2am Thursday 1 April until 6am Tuesday 13 April including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr and Shane Gould Ave. 

Other roads in the precinct will be closed prior to the Show from 16 March to allow for event set up, and some roads will remain closed after the Show until 20 April to allow for the removal of event infrastructure.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads within the Sydney Olympic Park precinct will be closed prior to the Show to allow for even infrastructure set up. Additional roads will close during the Show for crow safety and will remain closed until after the Show for event pack down.

FROM 1AM TUESDAY 16 MARCH TO APPROX. 10AM TUESDAY 20 APRIL 2021

  • Olympic Boulevard 100m north of Dawn Fraser Avenue adjacent to the Cathy Freeman Park amenities to 200m south of Edwin Flack Ave outside Qudos Bank Arena

FROM 12:01AM THURSDAY 18 MARCH TO 10AM TUESDAY 20 APRIL 2021

  • Australia Avenue from Murray Rose Avenue to Kevin Coombs Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Grand Parade
  • Grand Parade from Olympic Boulevard to Australia Avenue

FROM 2AM THURSDAY 1 APRIL TO 6AM TUESDAY 13 APRIL 2021

  • Kevin Coombs Avenue from Australia Avenue to Pondage Link
  • Marjorie Jackson Parkway from Wentworth Common Carpark to Australia Ave
  • Olympic Boulevard from Kevin Coombs to Sarah Durack Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Dawn Fraser Avenue
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Showground Road to Gate 15 (fixed closure) & Park Street
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Edwin Flack Avenue to Showground Road (Accessible drop off / pick up & Show drop off / pick up â€“ Edwin Flack Avenue to Fig Grove)
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Rod Laver Drive to Olympic Boulevard
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Olympic Boulevard to the M4 Exit (P4 car park)
  • Rod Laver Drive from Shirley Strickland to the Tennis Centre
  • Shane Gould Avenue at P2 Car Park
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.displayName: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Thursday 1 to Monday 12 April

properties.headline: Byron Bay Bluesfest - Thursday 1 to Monday 5 April - TYAGARAH Pacific Motorway at Gulgan Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of music fans are expected to attend the annual Byron Bay Bluesfest at Tyagarah Tea Tree Farm, just north of Byron Bay over the Easter Long Weekend from Thursday 1 to Monday 5 April.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the M1 Pacific Motorway at Tyagarah, and Ewingsdale Rd and Gulgan Rd interchanges on approach to the event. Local roads around Tyagarah may also be busy. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.
properties.displayName: Byron Bay Bluesfest - Thursday 1 to Monday 5 April

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Fish Markets Easter Trading info and map

properties.headline: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading  - Friday 2 to Monday 5 April - PYRMONT Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Bridge Rd approaching Sydney Fish Markets
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market will operate extended trading hours on Good Friday, 2 April from 5am to 5pm and regular trading hours for the remainder of the weekend until Monday.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area, particularly on Good Friday.

Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in very high demand.

Limited parking is available at the main Sydney Fish Market car park entry via Bank St. Additional parking will be available on Good Friday at the Sydney Secondary College on Pyrmont Bridge Rd.
properties.displayName: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading  - Friday 2 to Monday 5 April

roads.mainStreet: Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Bridge Rd

properties.headline: A-League - Thursday 1 April - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Adelaide United at Central Coast Stadium, Gosford, from 7:40pm to approx 9:40pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game on Thursday evening. 

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the game from 5:40pm and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Sydney Family Show - Thursday 1 to Sunday 18 April - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Entertainment Quarter
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Family Show is taking place at The Entertainment Quarter from Thursday 1 to Sunday 18 April from 10am to 5pm each day.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from The Sydney Family Show each day. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian movement.

properties.headline: NRL - Thursday 1 April - BROOKVALE Pittwater Road at Brookvale Oval
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Panthers at Lottoland Brookvale Oval from 8:05pm until 10pm approx. 

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Super Rugby -  Friday 2 April - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map Mar21SCO_1080.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Brumbies at the SCG from 7:45pm to approx 9:20pm

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on roads around the Moore Park precinct as Super Rugby fans travel to the SCG on Good Friday. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:25pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FROM 3PM TO 11PM - FRIDAY 2 APRIL

  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on roads around the Moore Park precinct as footy fans travel to the SCG on Easter Sunday. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4:15pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the precinct as The Sydney Royal Easter Show is taking place from 1 to 18 April at Sydney Olympic Park.

Footy fans driving to the game should plan to arrive early and pre-book parking online in advance as car parks typically reach capacity from the early morning on public holidays and weekends.

Roads in the precinct will be closed from 2am Thursday 1 April until 6am Tuesday 13 April including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr and Shane Gould Ave.

properties.headline: NewRun - Sunday 11 April - NEWCASTLE Wharf Rd, Shortland Esplanade & Memorial Drive to Bar Beach
properties.publicTransport: Route 21 buses will be affected. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Runners will participate in a marathon, half marathon, 5km or 2km events in the annual NewRun - Newcastle Running Festival starting from 6am at Queens Wharf travelling around the foreshore to finish back at Market St Lawn. The Hill to Harbour 10km run will start from Bar Beach at 8.30am also finishing at Market St Lawn.

Road Closures will be in place between 4am and 1pm on sections of roads around the event course. 

  • 4am to 11.30am - Wharf Rd from Watt St to Argyle St
  • 5.30am to 11.30am - Wharf Rd from Watt St to Nobbys Rd
  • 5am to 11.30am - Shortland Espl from Zaara St to Nobbys Rd
  • 5.30am to 9.15am - Memorial Dr from Bar Beach Ave to Kilgour Ave

Traffic is expected to be heavy between 5am and 10am as participants arrive and between 1pm and 3pm as they leave the area. 

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time while in the area and to follow the direction of traffic controllers.

roads.mainStreet: Wharf Rd, Shortland Esplanade & Memorial Drive

Road closures will be in place on sections of Harbour St between Stewart St and Crown St and Burelli St between Corrimal St and Harbour St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

properties.headline: Festival - Friday 19 to Monday 29 March - MAYS HILL Great Western Highway
properties.otherAdvice:
Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Great Western Hwy at Mays Hill as gatherers attend Sydney Murugan Temple for events between Saturday 19 March and Monday 29 March. The busiest days are expected to be Friday 19 March, Saturday 27 March and Sunday 28 March. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Festival & Parade - Friday 26 to Sunday 28 March - COWRA Kendal Street/Mid Western Highway between Lachlan Street AND Darling Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Cowra Festival of International Understanding is taking place from Friday 26 to Sunday 28 March.

On Saturday a parade will travel along Bartlett St, Brisbane St, Kendal St, Lachlan St and ending at the car park from 3pm to 4pm.

Kendal St/Mid Western Hwy between Lachlan St and Darling St and sections of Bartlett Ave will be closed between 2:30pm until 4:30pm. Low Level Bridge Rd will close from 3pm until 9pm, and Darling St from Kendal St to Bartlett St will also close from 1:30pm until 2pm.

Motorists will be detoured via College Dr, Liverpool St and Lachlan St in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.
properties.displayName: Festival & Parade - Friday 26 to Sunday 28 March
